title: Star Guardian Ahri is missing her whiskers
body:
https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ATcoJ7f1GuM/WYntEt8GV1I/AAAAAAAAq8Y/QgZVbkFhy2MWr9UJePTwMkKCid6H9j1iQCLcBGAs/s1600/6.png

https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-fqkRGovnErM/WYoCfvCw1KI/AAAAAAAAq-o/_LqLfl3k3ogTjeHE4QiEpP-UdWzTth_4wCLcBGAs/s1600/DGuewo8UIAAMDCy.jpg

I realize it's not the biggest deal, especially given the quality of the skin, but I still feel the fox should have her whiskers. She has them in every other skin.

replies.body:
Hello, I'm the concept artist on Ahri. 
Great catch! This was a tough decision for sure. The whiskers were removed to make the thematic and her aesthetic to be stronger and powerful. We wanted her to feel regal/pristine and a step above season 1 guardians on an aesthetic level. We even thought of other markings like hearts or stars on her face but felt off balanced and distracting. This was discussed during pre-production and even during the production but ultimately the team felt this was the right decision. Thank you for the feedback.

I'm not trying to be rude, but I don't understand how whiskers would result in the removal of "stronger and powerful" from the skin. Her stance and VO alone already do that.

The fox-like features (ears, whiskers, tails) are synonymous with Ahri - Arcade Ahri didn't have the whiskers on her splash art, but was later added due to this. 

Maybe it's because the ears, whiskers, and tails are on every Ahri skin that it just very noticeable when it's missing.

I think I understand why; Ahri's whiskers are usually textured on which gives the appearance of face paint. That of course has the unwanted side effect of making her look younger and more childlike, which removes a sense of maturity and adulthood from her appearance.

Not just that actually but in her lore its confirmed that the more "Power"/"Souls" she absorbs into her right? Make's her less fox like by just the slightest slightest eachtime Sooo one could in fact argue that she has taken so many souls along with being a star guardian thus speeding up the process making her look a little more human then usual. Now of course you can argue "WELP if she's so damn powerful why isn't she human?" To which My thought process on that is..she is still Ahri, it's theoretically possible after  being a star guardian she doens't desire as many souls and sustains her own well of power via the star light thus well she has become more human she still retains her vastayan core traits. OR simple answer "it still has to be Ahri." But all i'm arguing in this stance isn't so much as common sense of "why" but more of a "Cause" if were talking lore/story sense why she doesn't have whiskers. Hope this make's sense {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

Well, at least it is something you can add back in later relatively easily if you change your mind.

I think she looks better with the whiskers,  but I understand why you'd take them out.

Thank you for the reply, but I still don't fully understand how her whiskers would make her look any less regal. She's still at least part fox and it just feels weird to see her face without it. Maybe it's just because I'm so used to seeing them on every other skin.

I don't have a PBE account, but if it garnered enough attention there, is there any chance they could be added? Or could the playerbase possibly see how she would look with her whiskers and decide if she looks better with or without them?

So removing  something from someone make them even more powerful? I guess you guys could do a little lore about this skin, that show Ahri "sacrifice" her whiskers(temporary)  to unlock the Star Guardian's power.
----------------

The ruler of stars(the one who gave the powers to the Guardian Star(Ezreal, Lux, Ahri, Jinx, MF,Poppy, and hopefully soon Urgot) asked in return a sacrifice from Ahri.

"Now Ahri, it is your turn  to sacrifice something."

_Ahri's mind was preoccupied by this hard decision. She had to sacrifice a part of her to gain a new power to help her defeat the enemies. At last, her nose twitched and her whiskers moved along. Ahri decided to sacrifice her whiskers._

"Very well." _The ruler of stars rise his fingers and touch Ahri's whiskers. She felt an astronomous amount of energy within her whiskers and now stored within her body._ 

"From this point, each time you call upon the power of the Star Guardian(by touching your whiskers), your whiskers will retract within your skin, and unlock the power of the Star Guardian. After the battle, the power of the Star Guardian will be stored back within your body, and your whiskers will grow back."

"I, the ruler of star, declare Ahri as a Star Guardian!"

_Ahri felt stronger than before._ (gooooo Zeo). 

"Great powers come with sacrifices."

-----------------------------

I do not know about the lore of the skin, or the lore of Star Guardians. But hopefully, you get the idea.

PS: I know, my english is most likely the worse that you've seen... But hopefully you can understand the meaning of the message.

Honestly, it just feels so weird to see Ahri without whiskers. I feel like I'm just looking at some girl with tails, maybe a cosplay? Idk lol.

The VO is also super... ugh? Like I know hard work and time was put into it but as an Ahri main, I'm super disappointed... as are a lot of people, Ahri mains or not. Maybe there was supposed to be some idea of her being one of those popular rude girls in high school who knows they're pretty but uhhHHhhhHhhHH not a fan.
